channel.title: Preview of Patch 1.1.0
channel.description: # Patch will be out in the next few days. ## General: * New simplified game mode called Casual. (If it is popular enough, new players will be required to play X number of games of it.) * Old game mode now named Classic. * Everyone can now draw in their deathnote. * Spy/Cult Maid no longer counts as a visit. * Disabled the early game over checks for the time being. (Games would end when they shouldn't, even when things like DK's and abilities were accounted for.) * New female armor and crossbow execution added. ## Assassin: * Distract now usable during trials. ## Enforcer: * Removed Armored passive. * Protection now prevents visits to targeted Unseen member. ## King: * Removed Allies from starting King. * Added Night Ability Order to starting King - Prevent a player from voting tomorrow. 4 uses. * Abilities no longer count as visiting. ## Knight: * Changed Sacrifice icon. ## Mastermind: * Into the Shadows now hides the Mastermind's occupy immunity again. ## Princess: * Flirt now show Killer/Support and Offensive/Social. ## Psycho King: * Now permanently death immune at night. * Abilities no longer count as visiting. ## Ritualist: * Tornado reduced to two uses. * Brotherhood changed to single target, uses increased to three. ## Sorcerer: * Magic Dust uses reduced to 2. * Circle of Death uses reduced to 2. * New Day Ability Magic Cloak - Hides your visits at night. 2 uses. ## Bug Fixes: * Fixed a bug with some abilities not being usable during trials. * No longer shows multiple healing messages. * Fixed a bug where sometimes people wouldn't show up as visiting. The only abilities or classes that shouldn't show up as visiting will say so in the class card. * Some others. _______________________ # Casual Game Mode: ## Core Differences: * Changed almost all Blue Dragon classes and their conversions. * Prince remains the same. * The max number of each non-unique Blue Dragon class is 3. * Only the Unseen can spawn. * The Sorcerer and Inquisitor cannot spawn, but all other neutrals still can. * There is no Royal Blood. ## Magistrate - Investigative Blue Dragon * Spawns every game, is unique, and is unconvertable. * Day Ability Scout - Send a scout to watch a player. You will be alerted if they are converted. * Night Ability Expert Investigation - Determine if a player is part of the Unseen. * Night Ability Surveillance - Prevent visitors and learn the name of those that try. You will be alerted if an Unseen member tries. 3 uses. ## Inspector - Investigative Blue Dragon * Night Ability Examine - Limit a player's class type down to two options. Works the same way as the Princess' Flirt. * Night Ability Window Peek - Discover a player's faction. 2 uses. ## Champion - Killer Blue Dragon * Passive Armored - Your armor will protect you from the first attacker blocked by Sacrifice. * Night Ability Sacrifice - Protect a player, giving your life to kill their attackers. * Night Ability Entrench - You will become death and conversion immune, and will kill any attackers. Bypasses night immunity. 2 uses. ## Steward - Offensive Blue Dragon * Passive Dutiful - Immune to occupation and target changing. * Night Ability Serve Wine - Occupy a player by getting them drunk. * Night Ability Debauchery - Cause a player to target you. You will be immune to all attacks redirected. 2 uses. ## Mystic - Social Blue Dragon * Passive Call the Dead - Communicate with the dead at night. * Day Ability Telepathy - Telepathically send a message to everyone, they will not know who sent it. 2 uses. * Day Ability Private Matter - All whispers to and from you will be hidden from the public. 2 uses. * Night Ability Read Mind - See whispers to and from a player tomorrow. Cannot target King. Does not count as visiting. ## Medic - Support Blue Dragon * Passive Remedy Studies - Immune to Nightshade poisoning. * Night Ability First Aid - Heal a player back to life if they were attacked. * Night Ability Quarantine - Heal a player's poison and prevent all visitors. Can only be used on a player once. ## Sleuth - Investigative Unseen (Converted from Inspector) * Night Ability Study - Discover a player's class type. * Night Ability Watch Carefully - Discover a player's class. 2 uses. ## Gladiator - Support Unseen (Converted from Champion) * Night Ability Protection - Protect an Unseen member and prevent others from visiting. * Night Ability Frenzy - Guarantees the Assassin will kill their target. 1 use. ## Attendant - Offensive Unseen (Converted from Steward) * Passive Dutiful - Immune to occupation and target changing. * Night Ability Serve Wine - Occupy a player by getting them drunk. * Nigh Ability Drugged Wine - Drug a player and then force them to target someone. 2 uses. ## Seer - Social Unseen (Converted from Mystic) * Day Ability Telepathy - Telepathically send a message to everyone, they will not know who sent it. 2 uses. * Day Ability Private Matter - All whispers to and from you will be hidden from the public. 2 uses. * Night Ability Read Mind - See whispers to and from a player tomorrow. Cannot target King. Does not count as visiting. * Night Ability Mind Warp - Cause a player to receive incorrect feedback from their abilities. ## Sawbones - Support Unseen (Converted from Medic) * Night Ability Abscission - Make an Unseen member appear as Blue Dragon tonight. * Night Ability Drug - Causes a player to believe they were attacked and healed. 2 uses.

item.title: Preview of Patch 1.1.0
item.dc:creator: TinyDeer
item.description:
Oh boy. My initial reaction to this patch was that of dismay. But I’m willing to wait and see - I tend to overreact and think changes will be a bigger deal than they end up being in reality. That being said:

  • I argued strongly against splitting the player base and will continue to do so until proven wrong. I think it’s bad for the community to split ‘serious’ players with people playing for fun. Although that’s not the intent of Casual, it’s true that it’s essentially an easy mode. For the hard or ‘serious’ mode, an increase in competitiveness --> caring more about winning --> more rage at bad plays --> less fun/enjoyable to play. Also, I think it’s a positive to put new players in the same setting as more experienced players - I enjoy giving tips to newbies and would like to have that opportunity while still playing a complex game. I don’t want to see the kind of “Go back to Casual” insults that infest ToS.

  • I don’t see how the King is very relevant without Allies, and I don’t see why it needed to be removed entirely (couldn’t we have just made Neutrals not show up in the check, similar to Sheriff?). What incentive does the BD have to let the King lead early game, or to claim to him? What’s the incentive not to execute the King at the earliest opportunity? He has to have something to offer the BD either on his own, or through pressure/suspicion.

  • The distract change is ! Really looking forward to seeing, making, and suffering under these plays.

item.title: Preview of Patch 1.1.0
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
Ellie:

Distract now usable during trials.

This is a good start, but it’s still underpowered. it should last the entire day.

Ellie:

Added Night Ability Order to starting King - Prevent a player from voting tomorrow. 4 uses.

This is a good allies replacement, but it’s a bit underpowered. It should prevent voting, speaking, and using day abilities. Or replace it with this ability:
Confine - During the day, your target will not be able to speak to or hear anyone but you. They may not be voted up for treason or targeted by day abilities. They may not use day abilities. Everyone will be told who you confine.

Ellie:

Into the Shadows now hides the Mastermind’s occupy immunity again.

Shouldn’t it be Can’t touch this instead? Because if it was for only 3 nights then it would still be underpowered.

Ellie:

Tornado reduced to two uses.
Brotherhood changed to single target, uses increased to three.

Why? Tornado was fine at 3 uses. And this brotherhood nerf is too much. It should just be reworked.

Ellie:

Magic Dust uses reduced to 2.

Why? Inquisitor needs a rework, not a buff. Now it will be even harder to win as sorc.

Ellie:

Circle of Death uses reduced to 2.

Why? Circle of death needed a buff, not a nerf. At least make it so it’s usable at any time, can target self, and bypasses night immunity if you won’t revert this.

item.title: Preview of Patch 1.1.0
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
copy-paste from ptr notes

Hey Boslof, I’ve been giving it some thought, and I think the King needs a bit more tweaking before launch.

Order is potentially strong on the King, but they need to live for a decent amount of time for it to reach its full potential. However, without Allies, I don’t see this happening very often.

Don’t get me wrong - removing Allies is AMAZING. However, which is more valuable - Order, or a confirmed BD King? I’d be willing to bet that our Day 4 King executions will jump up by a lot once this patch hits, simply because Order isn’t really worth it.

I don’t know how much you’ve read of my “Some Ideas” mini-megathread, but I think that the solution to this is to give the starting BD King a few special mechanics. If you give the starting BD King an ability the BD will be unwilling to lose, and you punish the BD for incorrectly executing a BD King, the regicide rate is unlikely to spike as much. My personal suggestions are below, but pretty much anything works as long as it achieves this end goal.

orangeandblack5:

BD Boon: Starting Good King’s guards protect against conversion as well as kills.

BD Punishment: If a Good King dies to public execution or Butler, the royal bloodline is useless and royals may not step up early.
